Package core

Class Shape

java.lang.Object
core.Shape
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ellipse, Square, Triangle
public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object

An abstract shape class that encompasses the PShape class and contains methods for creating and editing shapes.

It also stores certain other useful information and has some utility functions.

It also has a static draw method, but it currently only works with three shapes:

  • Square (Rectangle)
  • Triangle
  • Ellipse

  • Constructor Details

    • Shape

      public Shape​(PApplet pApplet)
      Creates a new shape and associates it with the main pApplet.
      Parameters:
      pApplet - The handle of the main pApplet.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public abstract void create​(int x, int y, int w, int h, int stroke, int color)
      Creates a new shape with the given characteristics.
      Parameters:
      x - The X-coordinate of the new shape to create
      y - The Y-coordinate of the new shape to create
      w - The width of the new shape to create
      h - The height of the new shape to create
      stroke - The stroke of the new shape to create (currently unused)
      color - The color of the new shape to create

    • update

      public abstract void update()
      Updates the internal PShape if any of the attributes have changed.

    • isInShape

      public abstract boolean isInShape()
      Checks if the mouse currently is within the shape.
      Returns:
      True if the mouse is in the shape

    • highlightVertices

      public abstract void highlightVertices()
      Highlights all the vertices of the shape with little red circles, used so that the user can see if the shape is selected.

    • translate

      protected static int[] translate​(int x, int y, int w, int h)
      Translates possibly bad X, Y, width and height parameters (for example, if the shape is created in a bottom left to top right direction, creating negative width and height) to proper attributes with a positive width and height.
      Parameters:
      x - X-coordinate of the shape
      y - Y-coordinate of the shape
      w - Width of the shape
      h - Height of the shape
      Returns:
      An int array with the new corrected values in the format of [x, y, w, h]

    • assignCoords

      protected void assignCoords​(int[] coords)
      Assigns the coordinates of the shape from an int array. This format of int array is an output of the translate function.
      Parameters:
      coords - An int array in the format [x, y, w, h]

    • draw

      public void draw()
      Standard draw call for the shapes. To be called every frame.

    • draw

      public static void draw​(PApplet p, int x, int y, int w, int h, int color, ShapeType type)
      A static method that draws a temporary shape with the given characteristics for one frame. Used to temporarily and dynamically display shapes.
      Parameters:
      p - The pApplet object handle
      x - The X-coordinate of the shape to draw
      y - The Y-coordinate of the shape to draw
      w - The width of the shape to draw
      h - The height of the shape to draw
      color - The color of the shape to draw
      type - The type of the shape to draw. Currently supported are SQUARE, TRIANGLE and ELLIPSE.

    • moveBy

      public void moveBy​(int x, int y)
      Moves this shape relatively by a certain amount. Use moveTo() for absolute position.
      Parameters:
      x - The amount to change the X-coordinate by.
      y - The amount to change the Y-coordinate by.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo​(int x, int y)
      Moves the shape to an absolute point. Use moveBy() for relative movements.
      Parameters:
      x - The new X-coordinate.
      y - The new Y-coordinate.

    • select

      public void select()
      Selects this current shape. This highlights the current shape.

    • deselect

      public void deselect()
      Deselects this shape and stops highlighting it.

    • isSelected

      public boolean isSelected()
      Returns:
      True if the current shape is selected.

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()

    • setName

      public void setName​(java.lang.String nameToSet)

      public ShapeType getType()
